title: Calliostoma circumcinctum
text:
Calliostoma circumcinctum is a <a href="species">species</a> of <a href="sea%20snail">sea snail</a>, a marine <a href="gastropod">gastropod</a> <a href="mollusk">mollusk</a> in the <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> <a href="Calliostomatidae">Calliostomatidae</a>.
Description.
The maximum recorded <a href="gastropod%20shell">shell</a> length is 13 mm.
(Original description by W.H. Dall) The solid, strong, white shell has an elevated, conical shape. It contains seven whorls The small, dextral nucleus is polished and delicately reticulate The other whorls have two sharp, much produced, thin keels These are a little recurved at their edges, and crossed only by most delicate lines of growth. The base of the shell is flattened, ornamented with nine angular ribs, the outermost produced somewhat. There is no <a href="Umbilicus%20%28mollusc%29">umbilicus</a> The <a href="Aperture%20%28mollusc%29">aperture</a> is subrectangular, notched by the keels. The simple <a href="Columella%20%28gastropod%29">columella</a> projects somewhat at its anterior end, and is not callous. The appressed <a href="Suture%20%28anatomy%29">suture</a> is distinct, not channelled.
Distribution.
Found in the <a href="Caribbean%20Sea">Caribbean Sea</a> and the <a href="Gulf%20of%20Mexico">Gulf of Mexico</a>.
Habitat.
Minimum recorded depth is . Maximum recorded depth is .
